storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to generate attendance reports to achieve accurate tracking of employee presence and absences

testCases.title: Generate attendance report with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected date range
Time-tracking system is operational and integrated
At least one department exists in the system with employee attendance records

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options including date range picker, department dropdown, and employee selector

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., last 30 days) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the filter field without validation errors

steps.action: Select a department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and filters are accepted without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to submit report generation request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and attendance report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds showing employee names, timestamps, attendance status, and summary statistics

steps.action: Verify the report contains accurate attendance data with timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Report displays complete attendance records with check-in/check-out timestamps, total hours, and attendance status for all employees in the selected department and date range

postconditions: Attendance report is successfully generated and displayed on screen
Report data matches the applied filters
System logs the report generation activity
Report is available for export or further analysis

testCases.title: Export attendance report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance report has been successfully generated with valid filters
Report is currently displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads
User has sufficient storage space for downloaded files

steps.action: Generate attendance report by selecting date range and department filters, then clicking 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is displayed on screen with complete data including employee attendance records, timestamps, and summary information

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export to PDF' button in the report toolbar
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and automatically downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'Attendance_Report_[Department]_[DateRange].pdf'

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays the complete attendance report with correct formatting, all data fields, timestamps, headers, footers, and matches the on-screen report data

steps.action: Return to the attendance report screen and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is generated and automatically downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'Attendance_Report_[Department]_[DateRange].xlsx'

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using spreadsheet software
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with properly formatted data in columns, including headers, all attendance records, timestamps, formulas for calculations, and data matches the on-screen report

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing a sample of records between PDF, Excel, and on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: All three formats contain identical data with no discrepancies in employee names, dates, timestamps, or attendance status

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Excel file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Both exported files are accessible and readable
Export activity is logged in the system
Original report remains displayed on screen unchanged

testCases.title: Verify absenteeism highlights in attendance report
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance data exists with known absenteeism and punctuality issues
Time-tracking system is operational and accessible for verification
Test data includes employees with various attendance patterns (present, absent, late arrivals)
Department has at least 5 employees with mixed attendance records

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section and select a department with known absenteeism cases
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options

steps.action: Select a date range that includes days with absenteeism and punctuality issues, then click 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds showing complete attendance data for the selected department and date range

steps.action: Review the report for visual indicators of absenteeism (e.g., highlighted rows, color coding, icons, or special markers)
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism cases are clearly indicated with visual highlights such as red color coding or warning icons, making them easily distinguishable from normal attendance

steps.action: Review the report for punctuality issue indicators (e.g., late arrivals, early departures)
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality issues are clearly indicated with visual highlights such as yellow/orange color coding or clock icons, showing late check-ins or early check-outs with time differences

steps.action: Identify the absenteeism trends section or summary statistics in the report
steps.expectedResult: Report displays absenteeism trends including total absent days, percentage of absenteeism, patterns by day of week, and comparison to previous periods

steps.action: Access the time-tracking system independently and retrieve raw attendance data for the same department and date range
steps.expectedResult: Time-tracking system provides source attendance data including timestamps, attendance status, and employee records

steps.action: Compare the attendance report data with the time-tracking system source data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Report data matches source data with 98% or higher accuracy including employee names, dates, timestamps, attendance status, and absenteeism counts

steps.action: Verify that all highlighted absenteeism cases in the report correspond to actual absences in the source system
steps.expectedResult: 100% of highlighted absenteeism cases are verified as accurate against the time-tracking system with no false positives

postconditions: Absenteeism and punctuality issues are accurately identified and highlighted in the report
Report data accuracy is verified at 98% or higher against source system
Visual indicators are clear and easily interpretable
Report is ready for management review and decision-making
Data integrity is confirmed between reporting system and time-tracking system

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to highlight absenteeism trends in attendance reports to achieve proactive workforce management

testCases.title: Verify absenteeism trend highlighting in attendance report
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module with trend analysis features
Attendance data exists spanning multiple weeks/months to establish trends
System has sufficient historical data to perform trend analysis (minimum 30 days)
Test data includes departments with varying absenteeism patterns
Trend analysis algorithm is configured and operational

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options including date range, department selector, and trend analysis toggle

steps.action: Select a time period filter of at least 30 days to enable trend analysis
steps.expectedResult: Time period is selected and accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Select a department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected successfully and filter is applied

steps.action: Enable the absenteeism trend analysis option if available as a separate toggle
steps.expectedResult: Trend analysis option is enabled and system prepares to include trend data in the report

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button to request report generation with trend analysis
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and generates attendance report with absenteeism trend analysis within 5 seconds

steps.action: Review the report for visual absenteeism trend indicators such as graphs, charts, trend lines, or heat maps
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism trends are clearly indicated visually using charts (line graphs showing trends over time, bar charts comparing periods, or heat maps showing high-absence days) with color coding and clear legends

steps.action: Examine specific trend highlights including increasing/decreasing patterns, peak absence days, and recurring patterns
steps.expectedResult: Report displays specific trend insights such as 'Absenteeism increased by X% in the last 2 weeks', 'Highest absence rate on Mondays', or 'Recurring pattern detected' with visual emphasis

steps.action: Verify that individual employees with concerning absenteeism trends are highlighted or flagged
steps.expectedResult: Employees with absenteeism rates above threshold are highlighted with visual indicators and trend statistics showing their absence frequency and pattern

steps.action: Check the accuracy of trend detection by comparing identified trends with actual attendance data patterns
steps.expectedResult: Trend analysis achieves 90% or higher accuracy in detecting actual absenteeism patterns with minimal false positives

steps.action: Click 'Export to PDF' button to export the report with trend highlights
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded successfully with filename format 'Attendance_Trends_Report_[Department]_[DateRange].pdf'

steps.action: Open the exported PDF file and verify that all absenteeism trend visualizations are included
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all trend charts, graphs, visual highlights, color coding, and trend analysis data exactly as displayed in the on-screen report with proper formatting

steps.action: Return to report screen and click 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is generated and downloaded successfully with filename format 'Attendance_Trends_Report_[Department]_[DateRange].xlsx'

steps.action: Open the exported Excel file and verify that trend data and highlights are preserved
steps.expectedResult: Excel file includes trend data in tabular format, conditional formatting for highlights, embedded charts if supported, and all trend analysis metrics are intact and readable

postconditions: Attendance report with absenteeism trends is successfully generated and displayed
Trend analysis is accurate at 90% or higher
Visual trend highlights are clear and actionable for HR management
Report is exported successfully in both PDF and Excel formats with trends intact
HR Manager can identify absenteeism patterns for proactive workforce management
Export activity is logged in the system

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to export attendance reports in PDF format to achieve easy sharing and printing

testCases.title: Export attendance report to PDF
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Manager role
User has authorization to access attendance reports
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected period
Browser supports PDF file downloads
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page is displayed with report generation options

steps.action: Select the desired date range for the attendance report (e.g., current month)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and highlighted in the date picker

steps.action: Select department or employee filters if applicable
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed on screen with all attendance data including employee names, dates, check-in/check-out times, and status

steps.action: Verify the displayed report contains accurate attendance data
steps.expectedResult: Report shows correct attendance information matching the selected filters and date range

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates and a loading indicator appears

steps.action: Wait for the PDF export to complete
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and automatically downloaded to the default downloads folder within 5 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the downloads folder and locate the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is present with a meaningful filename (e.g., 'Attendance_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf')

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully without errors

steps.action: Verify the PDF contains all attendance data from the generated report
steps.expectedResult: PDF displays complete attendance data including all employee records, dates, times, and status information

steps.action: Check the formatting and readability of the PDF document
steps.expectedResult: PDF maintains proper formatting with clear headers, aligned columns, readable fonts, proper spacing, and professional layout

steps.action: Verify all table columns are visible and not cut off
steps.expectedResult: All data columns fit within the page boundaries and are fully visible

steps.action: Check if company logo, report title, and date range are displayed in the PDF header
steps.expectedResult: PDF header contains company branding, report title 'Attendance Report', and the selected date range

steps.action: Scroll through multiple pages if applicable to verify pagination
steps.expectedResult: Page numbers are displayed correctly and data flows properly across pages without data loss

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and saved in the downloads folder
PDF file is readable and printable
Original attendance report remains displayed on screen
User session remains active
No data corruption or loss occurred during export
System logs the export activity for audit purposes
